It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from deep red to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its unique morphology includes showy bracts that resemble small leaves, which are often mistaken for actual foliage. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Uvifera krugii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
